Issues.Title: Reordering of *ngFor list corrupts the current state of simple animations contained inside the item template.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

animations

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Setup:

- I have a list of products in a shopping cart, each with an Add button. 
- Products are displayed in an *ngFor list (with a trackBy function)
- When an item is 'Added',  the 'Add' button fades out using a simple opacity animation. (not with an *ngIf)
- At the same time a 'Remove' button is faded in.
- When the item is 'Removed' the buttons return to their original state.

Problem: 
- When the parent list of products is reordered (click 'Sort by Name') the simple opacity animation for the buttons gets broken (the current visible or hidden state appears to get corrupted or reset to void).
- By 'broken' I mean that the transition is not triggered from `visible => hidden` and the opacity changes instantly.

Important: This is NOT an `:enter` / `:leave` animation issue like https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/40752


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/issue-50861-v2?file=src%2Fmain.ts

Note: This link has been updated to a version using a new component for each product in the list.

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
The animation doesn't work immediately after the list is reordered.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.6
Node: 18.14.0
Package Manager: npm 9.3.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 16.0.0
... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1601.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.1.1
@angular-devkit/core            16.1.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.6
@angular/cli                    16.0.6
@angular/compiler-cli           16.1.2
@schematics/angular             16.0.6
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```


### Anything else?

I want to propose a hypothesis for what seems to be happening:

The Add / Remove buttons being animated are simple Angular opacity animations (not hidden with *ngIf). 

    <button [@visibilityAnimation]="(product.qty == 0) ? 'visible' : 'hidden'" 
            (click)="addToCart(product, 1)">Add to cart</button>

The animation is very simple:

```
export const visibilityAnimation = trigger('visibilityAnimation', 
[
  state('hidden', style({ opacity: 0 })),
  state('visible', style({ opacity: 1 })),

  // fade in
  transition('hidden => visible', [animate('1s')]),

  // fade out 
  transition('visible => hidden', [animate('.5s')]),
]);
```

So clearly the animation state can only ever be `'visible'` or `'hidden`' and one of the defined transitions should always work.

Indeed, before the list has been sorted, when adding an item, the `visible => hidden` transition is triggered as expected every time. 

After sorting the list - the `visible => hidden` or `hidden => visible` transitions aren't triggered on the next click (the button doesn't fade). However it isn't completely broken - once you click again it will work. 

It is as if the state of each animation is reset to a 'null' or 'void' state. In fact if you change the transitions to be `* => hidden` and `* => visible` then the animation always works. (This is unacceptable in reality since I don't want the animation to run when the page is loaded).

It may be possible to fix this by making the list items separate components, but that doesn't work well for my actual situation.

As mentioned above, any similar existing issues I was able to find are related to the *ngIf (:enter / :leave) animation mechanism which does not apply here. Whether or not they are related under the hood I have no way of knowing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reordering of *ngFor list corrupts the current state of simple animations contained inside the item template." (#50861)

Issues.Title: fix(upgrade): allow for downgraded components to work with component-router
Issues.Body:
In the past, we had an implementation of the "Angular 2" router that also worked with AngularJS. Published as `@angular/router`. We continued to expose that router implementation in G3 and some applications still use it. Now, when upgrading, they are seeing issues where the router throws because it cannot find a route config/ or `$canActivate` on the controller- simply because there is no `controller` function for downgraded components.

We can fix this and unblock the update by simply ensuring a controller function is defined.

Context: https://critique.corp.google.com/cl/539971007
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(upgrade): allow for downgraded components to work with component-router" (#50871)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): Support `$any` in template pipeline
Issues.Body: `$any(...)` casts should be dropped, except when they are an explicit call on `this.$any(...)`. Fix a bug in which we were transforming `ThisReceiver` into an implicit receiver.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler): Support `$any` in template pipeline" (#50869)

Issues.Title: fix(platform-browser): wait until animation completion before destroying renderer
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, the renderer destroy method was being called before the animation complete. This is problematic when using `REMOVE_STYLES_ON_COMPONENT_DESTROY` as it causes the styles to be removed too early.

This commit, updates this destroy logic to be call the render destroy once the animations complete.

This has been reported internally in:
- http://b/271251353#comment12
- http://b/282004950#comment5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(platform-browser): wait until animation completion before destroying renderer" (#50860)

Issues.Title: build: do not attempt deflaking locally
Issues.Body:
We've recently marked the ngtsc test as flaky for the Windows job. We should not attempt
running tests 3 times locally. This negatively impacts the debugging/developer workflow.

Instead, flaky test attempts can still be made on CI. Using the default attempt count of 3.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: do not attempt deflaking locally" (#50852)

Issues.Title: build: avoid shallow fetch for benchmark comparison
Issues.Body:
Currently when `yarn benchmarks run-compare` is used, the local repository could be converted to
a shallow clone. This is not a problem but might result in confusion. We avoid this by not performing
a shallow fetch when a comparison is initiated.

The performance gains seem negligible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: avoid shallow fetch for benchmark comparison" (#50851)

Issues.Title: Default redirect when using multiple named outlets doesn't work if a partial URL is supplied
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

With a router configuration like:

```
 {
    path: '',
    outlet: 'tab',
    redirectTo: 'first',
    pathMatch: 'full'
  },
  {
    path: 'first',
    outlet:  'tab',
  },
  {
    path: 'second',
    outlet: 'tab',
  },
 {
    path: '',
    outlet: 'caption',
    redirectTo: 'summary',
    pathMatch: 'full'
  },
  {
    path: 'summary',
    outlet:  'caption',
  },
  {
    path: 'action',
    outlet:  'caption',
  }
```

And a URL like: `.../(tab:first)`; with `pathMatch: 'prefix'` it would redirect to `.../details/(tab:first//caption:summary)` (due to the empty path redirect). With `pathMatch: 'full` the redirect no longer occurs, leaving the `caption` outlet empty. If *no* outlet segment is provided, ie. `.../details` then both redirects occur correctly.

I'd like the redirect to still occur; so portions of the page aren't accidentally empty.

Leaving `pathMatch: 'prefix'` in does seem to work (moving to the bottom of the array for safety) but feels like a workaround rather than the intended behavior.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.5
Node: 16.15.0
Package Manager: npm 8.5.5
OS: win32 x64

Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1600.2
@angular-devkit/core         16.0.2
@angular-devkit/schematics   16.0.5
@schematics/angular          16.0.5
```


### Anything else?

This was discovered while migrating from Angular 13 due to the runtime error if no `pathMatch` was supplied. It is unclear if `pathMatch: 'full'` would have worked in Angular 13.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Default redirect when using multiple named outlets doesn't work if a partial URL is supplied" (#50856)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): return full spans for Comment nodes
Issues.Body:
Change sourceSpan for Comment nodes to cover the whole comment instead of just the opening token. The primary motivation for this is the interaction between ESLint and `@angular-eslint`. ESLint can detect unused `eslint-disable` directives in comments and automatically remove them when running with `--fix`. This is based on ranges computed from AST spans, and as a result does not work inside Angular templates - right now all comments claim to be 4 characters long so only the opening ` - [x] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes - [ ] CI related changes - [ ] Documentation content changes - [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes - [ ] Other... Please describe: ## What is the current behavior? The HTML parser creates `Comment` nodes with `ParseSourceSpan` taken directly from the opening `COMMENT_START ` token, causing every comment to claim to be 4 characters long - `sourceSpan.toString()` always returns ``. ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [ ] Yes - [ ] No Not sure honestly. Several tests for `@angular/compiler` had to be updated because they expected a stringified version of the AST node to be `

no lint errors in this file

``` Since there are no call expressions, linting this file reports an unused directive: ``` src/app/app.component.html 1:1 warning Unused eslint-disable directive (no problems were reported from '@angular-eslint/template/no-call-expression') âœ– 1 problem (0 errors, 1 warning) 0 errors and 1 warning potentially fixable with the `--fix` option. ``` Running with `--fix` should remove the comment entirely, but instead produces the following change: ```diff - + eslint-disable @angular-eslint/template/no-call-expression -->

no lint errors in this file

``` The eslint directive ends up as text inside the component, which is not ideal.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): return full spans for Comment nodes" (#50855)

Issues.Title: Large build times for arm64 builds
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I am building a multi-architecture docker image for amd64 and arm64. The ``ng build`` command for amd64 takes ~40 seconds while the same command for arm64 is taking ~6 minutes.

Time taken for amd64:
![amd64](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/133945999/3b05ebe1-5389-469c-9d78-fdb02e9f8294)

Time taken for arm64:
![arm64](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/133945999/5793dcbd-a4de-4cab-aa8f-46314e3e885b)

I have tried setting various flags in configurations in angular.json, but this has had no effect.
```
"outputHashing": "all",
"optimization": true,
"buildOptimizer": true,
"vendorChunk": false,
"extractLicenses": false,
"sourceMap": false,
"namedChunks": false
```

The npm install command is also taking a lot more time for arm64. However, by caching the node_modules folder, I have reduced the time taken by that step for arm64 to ~50 seconds from ~150 seconds initially; this also reduced the time taken for amd64 from ~28 seconds to ~13 seconds.


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.0.5
Node: 16.15.1
OS: Linux x64
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Large build times for arm64 builds" (#50850)

Issues.Title: Naming conventions for signals
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

With `Observables` the naming convention was to end a variable name with a `$`. eg.:

```ts
variableName$: Observable<unknown>
```

For the signals the doc don't publicize a standard naming conventions

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.io/guide/signals

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

An example of proposal is start a variable name with a `sig`

```ts
sigVariableName:  Signal<unknown>;
```

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use built-in CSS vendor prefixing in esbuild
Issues.Body: As of esbuild v0.18.9, vendor prefixing of CSS is now supported. The esbuild target option is generated from a project's browserslist and the vendor prefixing will reflect the configured browsers for a project. This improvement allows for the removal of the postcss autoprefixer plugin from the build pipeline. This can provide a performance benefit for projects especially when project stylesheets contain nothing that would require prefixing since postcss processing can potentially be skipped completely.

Issues.Title: Ask for recreating ( overwritting files) the current project folder
Issues.Body:
### Command

new

### Description

I'm new to Angular and I just started using its CLI, it's easy to use and I appreciate it a lot.

However, I have noticed that it misses ( based on my experience with NextJS CLI) to ask the developer if the project ( folder ) exists and if he is sure that he wants to recreate the project and remove the old files.

##### STEP 01

`ng new my app`

##### STEP 02

Write some code and save the changes.


##### STEP 03

`ng new my app`

### Expected

The CLI asks that the project name exists.

### Current

Create a new project with the same name and replace older files with the new ones.




### Describe the solution you'd like

The CLI should inform the developer that the project name exists and recommends alternative names.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Invoke an error and enforce the user to change the name of the project name.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ask for recreating ( overwritting files) the current project folder" (#25453)

Issues.Title: Thanks for opening the issue but this is expected as LESS is not yet supported in the experimental Esbuild builder.
Issues.Body:
Thanks for opening the issue but this is expected as LESS is not yet supported in the experimental Esbuild builder.

Currently only Sass and CSS are supported. Support for Less will be added at a later stage.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Thanks for opening the issue but this is expected as LESS is not yet supported in the experimental Esbuild builder." (#25452)

Issues.Title: ng build breaks when a dependency uses big integer literals (despite target ES2022)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I do use the [optimization feature](https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#optimization-configuration) for my production bundles. `architect.build.configurations.production.optimization`

In the latest release of [@arcgis/core](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@arcgis/core) (4.27.x+) some features were built on top of big integer literals. Running `ng serve` or `ng build` (without `"optimization": true`) works properly, but using `optimization` it will throw the error below.

My tsconfig.json has `"module": "esnext"` and ` "target": "ES2022"` which should be fine since big integer literals should be available since es2020. I have no idea where it takes `target environment` from?

_No response_

Issues.Title: build: update ossf/scorecard-action action to v2.2.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [ossf/scorecard-action](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action) | action | minor | `v2.1.3` -> `v2.2.0` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>ossf/scorecard-action</summary>

### [`v2.2.0`](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/releases/tag/v2.2.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/compare/v2.1.3...v2.2.0)

#### What's Changed

-   :seedling: Bump github.com/ossf/scorecard/v4 from v4.10.5 to v4.11.0 by [@​spencerschrock](https://togithub.com/spencerschrock) in [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1192](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1192)

#### Scorecard Result Viewer

Thanks to contributions from [@​cynthia-sg](https://togithub.com/cynthia-sg) and [@​tegioz](https://togithub.com/tegioz) at [CLOMonitor](https://togithub.com/cncf/clomonitor), there is a new Scorecard Result visualization page at `https://securityscorecards.dev/viewer/?uri=<project-url>`.

-   [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-webapp/pull/406](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-webapp/pull/406)
-   [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-webapp/pull/422](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-webapp/pull/422)

As an example, you can see our own score visualized [here](https://securityscorecards.dev/viewer/?uri=github.com/ossf/scorecard)
Checkout our [README](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/blob/08b4669551908b1024bb425080c797723083c031/README.md#scorecard-badge) to learn how to link your README badge to the new visualization page.

#### Publishing Results

This release contains two fixes which will improve the user experience when `publish_results` is `true`

-   Runs that fail our [workflow restrictions](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/blob/08b4669551908b1024bb425080c797723083c031/README.md#workflow-restrictions) will fail with a 400 response indicating the problem, instead of a vague 500 status. ([https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1156](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1156), resolved [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/issues/1150](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/issues/1150))
-   Scorecard action will retry when signing results and submitting them to our web API. This should help with flakiness from connection failures. ([https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1191](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1191))

#### Docs

-   ðŸ“– Update README to accept fine-grained tokens by [@​pnacht](https://togithub.com/pnacht) in [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1175](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1175)
-   ðŸ“– Update installation instructions to match current GitHub UI  by [@​joycebrum](https://togithub.com/joycebrum) in [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1153](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1153)

-   [@​pnacht](https://togithub.com/pnacht) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1175](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard-action/pull/1175)

Issues.Title: Scss source maps mismatch in angular 16
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

After upgrading my project to Angular v16 from Angular v14, I noticed that the source maps of my scss files were mismatched
The source maps changed (not necessarily correctly) when I removed imports of external packages

I created a test project using angular cli and installed two of the packages we use - bootstrap and @ng-select/ng-select and I saw that the problem is restored

before importing bootstrap and @ng-select/ng-select scss
**app.component.scss**
```
.test {
  color: red;
}
```

![before](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/30690296/bde9a4af-fe8d-4484-b25a-8dbe694fd52f)



after importing bootstrap and @ng-select/ng-select scss
```
@import "../../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/bootstrap";
@import "../../node_modules/@ng-select/ng-select/themes/default.theme.css";

.test {
  color: red;
}

```

![after](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/30690296/b113b1d0-c3fe-4869-b7c0-367e9d422a52)


Importing bootstrap or ng-select separately works fine. I also tried other packages combinations and got mismatched source maps

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-ej8xiu?file=index.js

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Scss source maps mismatch
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.1.1
Node: 18.12.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 16.1.2

... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.1.1
@angular-devkit/core            16.1.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.1.1
@angular/cli                    16.1.1
@schematics/angular             16.1.1
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.1.3
```

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): prevent menu styles from leaking to other components
Issues.Body:
The menu theme was including the MDC list styles directly at the root of the theme which caused to leak into other components like `mat-list`.

The mixins will be removed in #27377, however currently the screenshot tests of a lot of internal targets assume that the leaky styles will be there which breaks the presubmit of #27377.

These changes introduce a *temporary* wrapper class around the mixins so that the incorrect screenshots can be approved before trying to land #27377.

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/menu): Mac OS VoiceOver cannot operate menu
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

Using VoiceOver on Mac OS, I am unable to open a CDK-enabled menu using the standard VoiceOver key combination for a button (Ctrl-Option-Space).

The same applies to selecting menu items after the menu is open (if opened some other way first).

### Reproduction

Go to the CDK menu examples page: https://material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples using Mac OS, with VoiceOver enabled. Tab to the button under "Google Docs Menu Bar" or "Menu with Standalone Trigger" or "Stateful Menu with Standalone Trigger".

VoiceOver announces "To display a list of options, press Ctrl-Option-Space". Press this key combination.

### Expected Behavior

Pressing Ctrl-Option-Space should open the menu. This is the standard VoiceOver command for activating any button or link.

### Actual Behavior

Pressing Ctrl-Option-Space has no effect.

The same occurs for v15: https://v15.material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples

But it works as expected for v14: https://v14.material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples

It also works as expected for the latest Material menu: https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples rather than the CDK.

### Environment

- Angular: 15, 16
- CDK: 15, 16
- Browser(s): latest Chrome, Edge, Firefox, or Safari
- Operating System: Mac OS (reproduced on both latest 13.4.1 and the much older 10.13.6)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk/menu): Mac OS VoiceOver cannot operate menu" (#27376)

Issues.Title: Remove synchronous loading example from Google Maps readme
Issues.Body: [The first example](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/README.md#loading-the-api) for loading the API in the Google Maps readme uses a synchronous `script` tag to load the API which is discouraged by the Google Maps team, because it loads everything up-front, even if a map isn't on the page. It can also slow down the entire if the Google Maps script takes longer to load. We should remove the example from our docs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove synchronous loading example from Google Maps readme" (#27374)

Issues.Title: Use importLibrary API to load Google Maps
Issues.Body:
Google Maps has an API that requires a minimal JavaScript snippet to allow for the full API to be loaded asynchronously. We should consider supporting it since it'll improve the DX of the Google Maps package. Note that using it would involve some refactoring to turn the existing synchronous call sites into asynchronous ones.

Docs for the `importLibrary` API: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/load-maps-js-api#dynamic-library-import
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use importLibrary API to load Google Maps" (#27373)

Issues.Title: feat(COMPONENT):  Design Tokens for Accessing Theme Colors as Variables at Runtime
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

This is related to this request.

https://github.com/angular/components/issues/27362

The request is for theme color variables that can be accessed at Runtime.  Something like:

```
p {
color: var(--mat-primary-default);
background-color: var(--mat-primary-contrast-default);
}
```

This is something that can be done currently only at compile time.

If Angular adds this, then themes that use the design Tokens can switch out the color theme and the design Token variable references will automatically apply the new values.

This allows for reloading of new themes only in order to change the color theme. 

With the way it's currently done, the entire app would have to be recompiled and redeployed in order to change the theme color values.

### Use Case

Change theme color values dynamically based on Design Tokens.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(COMPONENT):  Design Tokens for Accessing Theme Colors as Variables at Runtime" (#27369)

Issues.Title: feat(COMPONENT): Design Tokens for Accessing Theme Colors as Variables
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(COMPONENT): Design Tokens for Accessing Theme Colors as Variables" (#27362)

Issues.Title: DEV_ENVIRONMENT.md: add missing BAZEL_SH environment to mingwin's bash.
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Build and launch error following the DEV_ENVIRONMENT.md procedure

### Reproduction

I followed the DEV_ENVIRONMENT.md procedure to launch the dev-app.

```
# Developer guide: getting your environment set up
1. Make sure you have both `node` and `yarn` installed.
   We recommend using `nvm` to manage your node versions.
2. angular/components uses Bazel which requires certain Bash and UNIX tools.
   - On Windows: Follow the [instructions](https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/install-windows.html#installing-compilers-and-language-runtimes)
   to install [`MSYS2`](https://www.msys2.org/) and the listed "Common MSYS2 packages".
   Afterwards add `C:\msys64\usr\bin` to the `PATH` environment variable.
3. Fork the `angular/components` repo on GitHub.
4. Clone your fork to your machine with `git clone`.
   Recommendation: name your git remotes `upstream` for `angular/components`
   and `<your-username>` for your fork. Also see the [team git shortcuts](https://github.com/angular/components/wiki/Team-git----bash-shortcuts).
5. From the root of the project, run `yarn` to install the dependencies.

To build angular/components in release mode, run `yarn build`. The output can be found under `dist/releases`.

To bring up a local server, run `yarn dev-app`. This will automatically watch for changes
and rebuild. The browser should refresh automatically when changes are made.
```

I deleted %userprofile%/_bazel_%username%, but I have the same error.

### Expected Behavior

dev-app launch successful

### Actual Behavior

Issues.Title: refactor(material/core): switch option and option group to tokens API
Issues.Body: Reworks the `mat-option` and `mat-optgroup` themes to use the new tokens theming API.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(material/core): switch option and option group to tokens API" (#27364)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/schematics): clean up deep imports of devkit APIs
Issues.Body:
Removes deep imports for some devkit APIs from the CDK schematics code to avoid potential build issues.

Fixes #27344.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/schematics): clean up deep imports of devkit APIs" (#27363)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): placeholders for input show 'undefined'
Issues.Body:
Fixes a bug in the Angular Material `MatDateRangeInput` component where the start and end input show undefined if the placeholder is passed as undefined. This is because the input prop is not getting checked.

Fixes #27341
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/datepicker): placeholders for input show 'undefined'" (#27361)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): add validation to create-token-slot
Issues.Body:
Currently we look up if a token is set to null in the token map, and if it is, we don't emit the slot at all. The problem is that `null` is also returned if the token doesn't exist at all which may mask some bugs.

These changes add a check to verify that the token exists before trying to look it up.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/core): add validation to create-token-slot" (#27357)

Issues.Title: fix(material/date-range-picker): add default input for placeholder
Issues.Body:
Fixes #27341
This fix addresses an issue where a directive lacked a placeholder input property, resulting in the display of "undefined" when an undefined value was passed as a prop. The directive now handles the placeholder text appropriately, displaying the provided value if available, or falling back to a neutral state if the placeholder property is not set. This ensures a correct and consistent placeholder display for the directive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/date-range-picker): add default input for placeholder " (#27360)

Issues.Title: bug(material/sidenav): Unable to toggle sidenav from outside component
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(material/sidenav): Unable to toggle sidenav from outside component" (#27359)

Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

an optional date picker that could be added to calendar overlay. Like this repository:
https://github.com/h2qutc/angular-material-components

### Use Case

Sometimes date filtering has to be very specific that the time must be selected
